Review:I believe Kazuha have a lot of potential. Not because she's stable or whatever. It's because, one, at 3:39 you can tell that she was very displeased with the way she sings. She also winced everytime she lost pitch. Meaning that she understands it was shit and most likely can 'hear' where the flaws lies. Two, she was trained in a very short time. Now, she seems to be getting a hang of her 'rapping voice' and stable at it. She has much more power in her dance too. Fast adaptibility and a blank canvas on top of that. Meaning, with more practice of controlling her voice she might be able to turned into a decent singer. Three, she was a ballerina. She's most likely have a great beat and rythm awareness, thats kinda part of the job. Four, star qualities. Despite being in a completely different field of performance than she was in the past, she adjusted quick, seems to have an ambitious character, and believe in herself when she does things that she 'can' do. I'm looking forward to her career growth.Eunchae on the other hand, seems to not realize that she was singing kinda funny or maybe too fixated of singing well that she ended up not hearing it. She sounded unsure, and not confident. Voice is wriggly and stiff. Even Kazuha was having a fuller, more controlled voice than her most of the time. That can be improved with some practice and a lot of confidence, I think. Maybe train her ear too.Yunjin is flawless. Good execution, good confidence, good energy even when she made mistakes. Definitely not used to rapping which is fineChaewon needs more energy and maybe a little more confidence, she looked a little scared of mistakes. However, good techniques. Safe to say that Chae and Yunjin is the vocal back bone of the group.Sakura is sakura.People said that the fact that she was 11 years in the industry and still can't sing is ridiculous. Well, I beg to differ.Keep it in mind, idol in Japan is very different with Idol in SK. In Japan they focused more on fun songs, visual, synchronized dancing, and fan service. SK have been demanding their idol to be much more skilled. It's a fusion of what they do in Japan and a lot of western influence. So of course, she's seen as less skilled in SK. And her long years in the industry might be the problem. When you're used to speak and sing in a certain way for a long time, it became much more difficult to fix. So, bad singer, but we're not supposed to expect her to be beyonce. Lower ur expectation when it comes to kkura. Thats all I'm gonna say. She's still a great idol.
